item.title: Erika add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If there are as many minds as there are men, then there are as many kinds of love as there are hearts." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Erika add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Adventures do occur, but not punctually." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Erika add a quote by Emily Wing Smith
item.description: "Being soaked alone is cold. Being soaked with your best friend is an adventure." -- Emily Wing Smith

item.title: Erika add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Adventure is not outside man; it is within." -- George Eliot

item.title: Erika add a quote by Tim Daly
item.description: "I feel the need to endanger myself every so often." -- Tim Daly

item.title: Erika add a quote by Jeff Rasley
item.description: "You have to get lost before you can be found." -- Jeff Rasley

item.title: Erika add a quote by Calvin Trillin
item.description: "The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found." -- Calvin Trillin

item.title: Erika add a quote by Rita Rudner
item.description: "I read recipes the same way I read science fiction. I get to the end and say to myself "well, that's not going to happen" -- Rita Rudner

item.title: Erika add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: Erika add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "[Kids] don't remember what you try to teach them. They remember what you are." -- Jim Henson

item.title: Erika add a quote by Trenton Lee Stewart
item.description: "May your adventures bring you closer together, even as they take you far away from home." -- Trenton Lee Stewart

item.title: Erika add a quote by Lee Maynard
item.description: "I loved autumn, the one season of the year that God seemed to have put there just for the beauty of it." -- Lee Maynard

item.title: Erika add a quote by William Cullen Bryant
item.description:
"Autumn...the year's last, loveliest smile."
[<i>Indian Summer</i>]" -- William Cullen Bryant

item.title: Erika add a quote by Andrea Gibson
item.description: "Autumn is the hardest season. The leaves are all falling, and they're falling like they're falling in love with the ground." -- Andrea Gibson

item.title: Erika add a quote by John Donne
item.description:
"No spring nor summer beauty hath such grace as I have seen in one autumnal face."
[<i>The Autumnal</i>]" -- John Donne

item.title: Erika add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Erika add a quote by Jim Bishop
item.description: "Autumn carries more gold in its pocket than all the other seasons." -- Jim Bishop

item.title: Erika add a quote by Jarod Kintz
item.description: "I want to say something so embarrassing about September that even the leaves start blushing and turning red." -- Jarod Kintz

item.title: Erika add a quote by Lauren DeStefano
item.description: "Fall has always been my favorite season. The time when everything bursts with its last beauty, as if nature had been saving up all year for the grand finale." -- Lauren DeStefano

item.title: Erika add a quote by Marc Riboud
item.description: "Taking pictures is savoring life intensely, every hundredth of a second." -- Marc Riboud

item.title: Erika add a quote by Sam Levenson
item.description: "Siblings: children of the same parents, each of whom is perfectly normal until they get together." -- Sam Levenson

item.title: Erika add a quote by Veronica Roth
item.description: "Scrubbing the floor when no one else wanted to was something that my mother would have done. If I can't be with her, the least I can do is act like her sometimes." -- Veronica Roth

item.title: Erika add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "This is part of what a family is about, not just love. It's knowing that your family will be there watching out for you. Nothing else will give you that. Not money. Not fame. Not work." -- Mitch Albom
